revised_title: Spectra of Nebulae and Fixed Stars: A Study of Nebulae as Luminous Gas
tldr: This study examines the spectra of nebulae and fixed stars, concluding that many nebulae are massive luminous gases rather than clusters of distant stars. The author uses a prism to analyze the light from various nebulae, discovering that their spectra consist of three distinct lines. This research challenges the idea that all nebulae are clusters of stars and suggests that they are composed of luminous gas or vapor.
